data.title: Painfully Slow Service
data.text: A recent trip to Owensboro reminded me to write a review about the previous experience.  When someone suggested the Miller House, there was a chorus of "no" from our group.  We had dinner in the basement/bar area and it was a really neat atmospher.  The meal service with no appetizers was well over 90 minutes wait.  It was way too much.  The staff appologized and provided a free desert, but it was proabably too little too late.  Admittedly, the food was pretty good and the staff friendly.

data.title: AWESOME EVERYTHING!!!!!!!!!!
data.text: I cannot rave enough about our experience at The Miller House Restaurant. We were in town due to a friend having surgery and it happened to be our 3rd Anniversary. We went for dinner and were blown away by the service, the food, and the bourbon selection. We tried a flight of Rye Bourbon's they were all excellent, our fav was the Old Grandad 114. We ordered the bourbon honey chicken wings and they had a subtle bourbon flavor and honey which was excellent. We then had a filet and au gratin potatoes. I have had steaks everywhere...this was hands down the best filet I and my husband have ever had! The service IMPECCABLE!!! Carol was the best server I have encountered..and I am over 50 yrs old! The chocolate cake slice that we didn't order but Carol brought to us made my eyes roll in the back of my head....If your are anywhere near Owensboro, KY..DO NOT MISS THIS RESTAURANT!!!

data.title: Good food, poor service
data.text: I've been to Miller House 4 times. The first two times, good food, good service. But the last two times the service was poor with long waits, food being served to people at our table at different times, little attention by server. Once there was a large, very loud group in the same room which inhibited any conversation at our table. I gave them a second chance and they failed. Won't go back.

data.title: Luncheon
data.text: We ate lunch there and the food was delicious.  Had a summer squash,  chicken soup. It was delicious. Also had the vegetable plate which included diced summer squash and fried green tomatoes. They were both delish. Waiting on dessert which is a chocolate cake with butter cream icing. Eating in a restored house was a great experience. Would definitely like to try dinner sometime as we r passing through.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Had the soup tomato basil and fried green tomato sandwich. Also apple crisp. Great food with great freinds

data.title: Lovely Atmosphere, Spirits, Delicious Dinner
data.text: Like dining in the nice southern house of a family member, Miller's serves up delicious Southern fare with flare. Fried green tomatoes, catfish, BBQ. Extensive spirits menu. Or you could go downstairs, if you prefer. Very much enjoyed.

data.title: Great employees
data.text: Loved the lower level with the bar. We had a bourbon flight. Staff was very knowledgeable. Great fun. Then went upstairs for dinner. A little stuffy.  Should have stayed downstairs.  Had the scallops. Bad. So salty could not eat. The waitress was very upset. Brought a new plate out. Could not eat. The salad, vegetables and desert were great. My husband had the ribeye that was perfect!  The staff was great.  Really did enjoy our visit!

data.title: Best restaurant in the area.
data.text: The atmosphere is delightful, fun and sophisticated. Menu is just right. Everything we ordered was cooked to perfection.

data.title: First Class
data.text:
Eat at Miller House for delicious food, excellent service and to make a great impression or show appreciation to someone special. 
The butternut squash is incredible. The sautéed spinach makes converts of people who hate spinach. Everything we've ever had there has been the best. Real chef preparations in this small town.

data.title: Not a great experience
data.text: I have visited on numerous occasions with friends, family and business. The quality of food and service is not consistent. You may go once a week for two weeks and all is good and the next trip you question why you came. I have eaten downstairs, second floor and third. Some of the wait staff is not professional. On one occasion my friends and I reserved a specific table and when we arrived they seated us at another because they had given that table to a family friend of the owner. The last trip was a group of couples for a night out. Our waitress was not friendly at all.  She acted as if we were an inconvenience for her, never smiled and had that perpetual look of "Oh my would you just hurry up". I think they are more into their bar than food service. Not high on my list of restaurants. Go but you have been warned.

data.title: Extravagant
data.text: Just the other night my mom and I went and there for a dinner date. When we pulled up, there was a band playing outside on the balcony. We walked inside and it was beautiful. I had the NY strip with cooked spinach, and summertime risotto. It was really good. My mom got the sirloin, and it was a little red on the inside, so our waitress took it back into the kitchen and cooked it a little longer. The actual chef came out and apologized to my mom. The atmosphere was great. We really enjoyed it and most defiantly will go back. Everyone was extremely nice.

data.title: Elegant dining in an mansion
data.text: Located in a 1905 house this restaurant provides a unique dining experience. We first started with cocktails in the basement bourbon bar. Rated as one of the best in the country, you can choose from over 300 bourbons. Price range from $5 to over $100 for a shot. Cocktails made from bourbon are affordable starting  about $6. The dining area is located on two levels plus outside seating on the porch or patio. Menu has a very good selection featuring southern specialties, steaks, chicken and fish. Expect to pay $18 to $30 for entrees. Charming, friendly service for beginning to end.

data.title: Superb food; superior attitudes
data.text:
Our first mistake was not making reservations. But after all, it was 5 PM on a Wednesday. When asked if we had reservations we were met with a "I may have something in the basement' At that point we were four of that many others eating there. We asked ourselves 'can they be that busy at this time and day?' Our table for four was on a wall in he bar within touching distance of the elevator. Our server, never offered his name, seemed put out with us. Flashlights on our phones were the only way to see the menus. Our server's superior, almost disdainful attitude, never softened. 
Ah, but the food! I enjoyed the park chop with mashed potatoes. There was a sweet peach salsa served with it. Delicious. So generous I took half home. My husband had the crab cake which he also declared delicious. Our friends had meat loaf with potatoes and salmon both were devoured in record time. Fried green tomatoes were enjoyed as an appetizer and are recommended. The question, of course, is would we return? Does the quality of the food outweigh the quality of the service? Not for me. This was my second visit. The same staff attitude was experienced both times  When we left this time there were only a few more diners than when we entered giving rise to the belief that we could easily have been seated in the dining room where we could have had light to read the menu and not have interrupted the bartender to wait on us. If you go, please make reservations.

data.title: Wow
data.text: Huge selection of Bourbon drinks. Enjoyed the Southern Sampler appetizer yum every piece on that plate was great. My entree was the pork chop and it was a bit dry. But the very best part? Sweet potato biscuits my waitress called them cookies... Best thing over ever eaten!

data.title: One of the Best In Owensboro!
data.text: We moved to Owensboro five years ago from a resort area that is full of fine dining choices. Miller House is one of the few restaurants in Owensboro that is consistently great!  We recently ate there again and our party of four enjoyed each of our meals from steak to salmon to chicken.  All with a fantastic choice of Bourbons from the well stocked Spirit Bar.  We look forward to every visit!

data.title: Am coming back soon!
data.text:
Great find! Situated in an old house but great remodeling makes it stellar. 

Was a business lunch so couldn't avail myself to the expansive bourbon collection, but I'm planning a weekend trip back soon!

data.title: Excellent food and lots of bourbon
data.text: Business dinner was most excellent. I had the sirloin, business partner had the ribeye. Both very tender and seasoned just right. Sides were fresh and salad was awesome. I was amazed with the sweet potato rolls. Not a fan of the sweet potato but these rolls were amazing. Making another visit before this business trip ends.

data.title: Worth a long drive if you don't live close.
data.text: We happened on this place by luck because we wanted to try something new. As it was a Wednesday night we didn't think it would be very busy and didn't make reservations. Turned out to be a mistake in our favor though as we decided to wait for a table and went down to the bar for a drink. While savoring one of their many bourbon flights we enjoyed conversing with the very knowledgeable bartender who gave us a history of the restaurant and also shared information about the many bourbons on offer. It was so pleasant at the bar that we decided to eat there instead of waiting for a table. I had the tomato pie which may not sound tempting at first but was incredibly delicious. My companion had the meat loaf and throughly enjoyed it. We would honestly consider making the three and a half hour drive it would take us just to dine here again.

data.title: Wenesday dinner.
data.text: Wonderful drink selection. Great appetizers and service. Food was served prompt and hot. Definitely a must visit place in Owensboro.

data.title: Atmosphere Super...
data.text: The food in this old remolded house is wonderful.  The salads are fresh and the menu has lots of choices.  I don't think I have ever eaten sweet potato biscuits but they have them here and they are a treat!  I am not a bourbon drinker but if you are they have a wonderful Bourbon bar and great drinks I hear.
